screens.name: Remove_external_devices_and_perform_hard_reset
screens.label: Remove external devices and perform hard reset.

fields.name: Removeexternaldevicesandperformhardreset
fields.fieldText:
Procedure Perform a Hard Reset Perform a full shutdown on the computer. (Do not suspend or hibernate) Remove all the external peripherals, if any, connected to the system. For laptops: Remove the battery (if the battery is Customer removable unit CRU) and unplug the power cable from the system For desktops: Disconnect the power cable from the back of the system. Check for any removable media in the system and remove if present. i.e. DVDs, USB drives, SD cards After unplugging, press the Power button for 30 seconds to drain any residual power from the computer. For laptops: Reinsert the battery and plug in the power cord. If the battery was not removed, then plug in only the power cord. For desktops: Reconnect the power cable and any necessary peripherals (Mouse, Keyboard, Monitor) If the system boots, perform a soft boot/restart to determine if the system will reboot without having to perform a hard shutdown.
Note: If it is not possible to remove external peripherals and perform the hard reset (due to user disabilities for example), perform a reboot without removing the devices. If the system will still not boot, recommend the user get help removing the peripherals prior to performing OS recovery steps or replacing any hardware.

fields.name: Does_the_system_boot
fields.fieldText: Does the system boot?

fields.name: RunePSADiagnositcs
fields.fieldText:
Run ePSA
Dell Enhanced Pre-Boot System Diagnostics (ePSA) are diagnostics that are built into the hardware of your system. These tests allow you to check the hardware of your system from outside the WindowsÂ® operating system removing software from the diagnostic process.
To run ePSA, perform the following steps:
For Dell Desktop or All-In-One Restart the computer As the computer boots, press F12 when the Dell Splash Screen appears At the One Time Boot menu, press the arrow key to highlight Diagnostics and press enter A graphical menu, listing all the discovered devices in the system is now displayed and the express diagnostics will run Note: Takes about 4 minutes to complete
For Dell Portable: Shutdown the computer Press and Hold the <Fn> key while pressing the power button, then release both A graphical menu, listing all the discovered devices in the system is now displayed and the express diagnostics should run If the diagnostics fail, make a note of the error code Based on the diagnostic findings, the code will assist you in troubleshooting the fault Note: Takes about 4 minutes to complete

screens.name: Screen_1a_Remove_external_devices_and_perform_hard_reset
screens.label: Screen 1a Remove external devices and perform hard reset.

fields.name: Screen1a_Content
fields.fieldText:
Procedure

Perform a Hard Reset

1. Perform a full shutdown on the computer. (Do not suspend or hibernate) 2. Remove all the external peripherals, if any, connected to the system. a. For laptops: Remove the battery (if the battery is Customer removable unit CRU) and unplug the power cable from the system b. For desktops: Disconnect the power cable from the back of the system. 3. Check for any removable media in the system and remove if present. i.e. DVDs, USB drives, SD cards 4. After unplugging, press the Power button for 30 seconds to drain any residual power from the computer. a. For laptops: Reinsert the battery and plug in the power cord. If the battery was not removed, then plug in only the power cord. b. For desktops: Reconnect the power cable and any necessary peripherals (Mouse, Keyboard, Monitor) 5. If the system boots, perform a soft boot/restart to determine if the system will reboot without having to perform a hard shutdown. Note: If it is not possible to remove external peripherals and perform the hard reset (due to user disabilities for example), perform a reboot without removing the devices. If the system will still not boot, recommend the user get help removing the peripherals prior to performing OS recovery steps or replacing any hardware.

fields.name: Does_the_system_boot_v2
fields.fieldText: Does the system boot?

fields.name: Is_the_system_configured_with_RAID
fields.fieldText: Is the system configured with RAID?

fields.name: Screen5_1_Content
fields.fieldText:
Procedure

Troubleshoot as Hard Drive issue

fields.name: Screen5_3_Content
fields.fieldText:
Procedure

Troubleshoot as a No POST Issue

When redirected to the No POST guided path be sure to select "No POST" rather than No Power.

fields.name: Screen5_Content
fields.fieldText:
Procedure

Run ePSA

Dell Enhanced Pre-Boot System Diagnostics (ePSA) are diagnostics that are built into the hardware of your system. These tests allow you to check the hardware of your system from outside the WindowsÂ® operating system removing software from the diagnostic process. To run ePSA, perform the following steps: For Dell Desktop or All-In-One 1. Restart the computer 2. As the computer boots, press F12 when the Dell Splash Screen appears 3. At the One Time Boot menu, press the arrow key to highlight Diagnostics and press enter 4. A graphical menu, listing all the discovered devices in the system is now displayed and the express diagnostics will run Note: Takes about 4 minutes to complete For Dell Portable: 1. Shutdown the computer 2. Press and Hold the key while pressing the power button, then release both 3. A graphical menu, listing all the discovered devices in the system is now displayed and the express diagnostics should run 4. If the diagnostics fail, make a note of the error code 5. Based on the diagnostic findings, the code will assist you in troubleshooting the fault Note: Takes about 4 minutes to complete Reference: http://kb.dell.com/infocenter/index?page=content&id=SLN293620 If you dispatching against an ePSA code , you must use the Dell Code Validation tool. 1. Go to https://satc.dell.com/#/ 2. If this is your first use enter your settings preferences 3. Ensure any popup blocker is disabled for this site 4. Input the Service tag and click search 5. Enter the ePSA code and validation code then click submit 6. Record the ePSA error code and the validation code in your log. EPSA Test Results
